data.title: Fantastic burger
data.text: You won't go wrong getting a burger at The Garage.  Many topping choices as well as meat choices.  I had the bison bacon cheeseburger.  Absolutely wonderful.  Enjoyed the sweet potato fries as well.  Loved the atmosphere, especially since they were showing Gene Wilder's Willy Wonka on the TV.  Classic!

data.title: Great burgers
data.text: Great food and friendly service.  My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is it is small and can be very crowded and claustrophobic.  Parking can be tough on Main Street in Norman, too.  I like the west Oklahoma City location much better which has an open, airy feel and a large parking lot.  We were entertaining an Australian government visitor and he really enjoyed the experience, however.

data.title: Great burgers.
data.text: I come here for the burgers,  but return for the fries. The garlic fries and the thunder fries are the best.

data.title: Dark and rustic
data.text: I have been to 3 different Garage locations.  The Norman one is the only one I don't care for.  The others are great and I would give 4 stars to them.   The food and service in Norman are no where near as good as the others.  On a personal note I don't care for the dark grungy atmosphere as compared to the other locations which are bright and open.

data.title: The Burger of a Lifetime!
data.text:
We each had their regular cheeseburger:

Crunchy, crispy irregular shaped (hand formed) Angus beef patty, cooked on a flattop grill, on a melt-in-your mouth bun accompanied by just "crispy enough and perfectly-seasoned" fries.....

If you pass an opportunity to eat here, you will have a hole in your bucket list.

Start your plans today...

data.title: Tasty Burgers
data.text: First time eating at The Garage, but not the last. The Theta burger was delicious and the fries tasty. Service was prompt and friendly.

data.title: Just so-so.
data.text: Not sure how this gets a number one ranking for dining establishments in Norman.  Food is OK, but nothing to write home about.  I had the chili cheese dog.  Dog was OK, chili was sparse and bun was poor.  My wife had the basic cheeseburger.  I was good, but nothing special.  If you're in the area you might want to stop, but don't make a special trip.

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: The food is always good. The vegetarian burger can be cooked separately in a separate pan so it is not cooked with meat. The drinks are great here too. Lots of choices and great to hang out at with friends.

data.title: Go ahead and get the Super G
data.text: We did, and it was first time...no regrets! Place was packed due to Main Street Art and Pub Crawl, but the service was spot on.  Burger was huge (double meat), hot and messy. Ended using a fork. Fries were great, not too crispy and like steak fries. Yum. Going back.

data.title: Last meal before baby
data.text: This was the place I wanted to go before having my baby.  It is absolutely amazing.  They have he best burgers and fries anywhere in Norman.  They have a large range of drinks also.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: I love the garage because of the options. You can get beef, turkey, and buffalo patties with all kinds of toppings. I usually get the turkey burger with pineapple salsa on it. Pretty good!

data.title: You can't get a better burger anywhere else
data.text: The food is always good and there's a good variety on the menu. The wait staff is always courteous and at hand to take care of your needs.

data.title: Supper
data.text: Fried onion bison burger qith sweet potato fries and apicy ketchup is my favorite.   Best onion burger within a hundred miles of here....

data.title: Blonde & Light Beer w/your Burger
data.text: Burgers were good. If you like blonde and/or light beers, this is your place. If you like Browns or Ambers w/your meal, pass this place on by. Manager indicated that out of the 8 taps, only two were available for change. Said that younger crowd preferred the light brews.

data.title: The Best Burgers In Norman!!!
data.text: The Garage is hands down the best place for burgers and beers in Norman.  Their entire menu is legit and the bar has a great atmosphere with a good mix of regulars and those passing through.  They also have a great selection of video games in the back, if you're into those sorts of things.  The Garage is a little pricey but well worth every penny....give their bison burgers and turkey burgers a try and don't forget the parmesan fries.

data.title: What a burger!!
data.text: I landed in this little spot to give it a shot, based on reviews here.  I was so happy that I did.  The burgers were a thing of beauty and tasted among the best I have had in years.  Great beer list, excellent diner-type or pub-type food in a comfortable environment with excellent service.  I will be coming back here again and again when in the area.

data.title: Great Burgers and sweet potato fries
data.text: We visited on a Thursday for lunch. We had angus burgers and fries. The sweet potato fries are amazing and the burgers were too. It was steady but not too busy to get great service. The place is open late and serves what seems to be a full bar but during the day at least, it is family friendly.

data.title: Not my first choice
data.text: Good buffalo burger with slaw on it.  Hard to get a drink after you set at a table.  Must go to a line to place your order...no waiter. Prefer better service.  Looks like good for kids....

data.title: Enjoyed the Bison Burger
data.text: I'm writing this after my second time eating lunch at The Garage.  Since I'm not from the area, it's been 10 months since last I had eaten there.  When the client I was working with suggested eating there, I quickly said YES.  Both last time and this time I got the Buffalo burger.  It is delicious and the fries are very good also.  I hope it doesn't take me another 10 months to get back again.

data.title: Good food and great location
data.text:
Wanting a local place to go and try this first night, we stumbled into this place.  After following the signs, we ordered towards the back of the bar.  Food was ordered there then we moved to the front to order our drinks...gotta love Oklahoma.  Food came quickly and was extremely well made, I did a burger and my compatriot did the fish and chips.  
Can recommend this and would love to see it on a weekend.
